sub_title: Historian, Author and Biographer Eelco Van Kleffens; Lecturer School of Law, Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen; Honorary Research Fellow Fryske Akademy, Leeuwarden
summary:
Historian, holding a doctorate in modern history from University of Groningen; senior researcher with an active research agenda as demonstrated by articles in peer reviewed journals and edited volumes in the Netherlands and abroad and several books (latest: 'Majesteit, U kent het werkelijke leven niet'. De oorlogsdagboeken van mr. E.N. van Kleffens (Majesty, You Don't Know Real Life: The War Diaries of the Dutch Minister of Foreign Affairs E.N. van Kleffens) (Nijmegen: Vantilt, 2019); current research project: 'Mr. E.N. van Kleffens: een politieke biografie'; lecturer School of Law, Hanze University of Applied Sciences Groningen, the Netherlands; extensive experience in lecturing at different levels (BA and MA students, part-time students, adult education), and in various formats. 
Fields of specialization: Dutch and international political culture in the 19th and 20th century; international organizations (esp. the League of Nations) and associations, transnational movements and networks; Dutch monarchy; history of the Dutch and international peace movement; world war 1 and 2; conflict and security; European history; foreign policy of the Netherlands; applied legal research.
Scientific interests: historiography of international relations; war and society; cultural internationalism; international civil servants; biographies; European and international law; privacy.
